along side of heel knit 30 sts from 2nd yarn and 3rd needles onto one needle pick up and knit 15 sts along shown in sweet paprika vivace 100% superwash merino wool other side of heel then knit 9 heel sts there are 78 sts in the 50g/230 yds 2 skeins flamingo round 24 sts on 1st dpn 30 sts on 2nd dpn and 24 sts on 3rd dpn and the beginning of round is now at centre of heel needles round 1 1st dpn knit to last 3 sts k2tog k1 2nd dpn knit 3rd size 2 2 75mm set of 4 double-pointed needles dpn k1 ssk knit to end 2 sts decrease or size needed to obtain gauge round 2 knit notions repeat rnds 1 and 2 until 60 sts remain yarn needle foot gauge work in st st until sock measures 1¾ less than desired length 16 sts and 22 rnds = 2 in st st worked in the round toe pattern notes round 1 1st dpn knit to last 3 sts k2tog k1 2nd dpn k1 ssk knit to ensure that the stripes match up in each sock make a note to last 3 sts k2tog k1 3rd dpn k1 ssk knit to end 4 sts decrease of which section of the colour repeat you use to start the first round 2 knit cast-on so that you can start the second sock in the same place repeat rnds 1 and 2 until 20 sts remain knit 5 sts from 1st dpn onto 3rd dpn graft toe using kitchener stitch when working the hem if you find it difficult to k2tog with the cast-on edge you can always leave it and sew the hem down finishing after the socks are finished weave in all ends sock kitchener stitch break yarn leaving a long tail and thread tail onto yarn needle hem cast on 60 sts and divide so that there are 15 sts on 1st dpn holding both dpns in the left hand with one behind the other 30 sts on 2nd dpn and 15 sts on 3rd dpn join for working in the graft the sts together as follows insert the yarn needle through round being careful not to twist work 6 rnds in st st
